Key Match Events: The Cavaliers blitzed the Mavericks, 32-21, in the first quarter and carried that momentum to a 134-122 final for their ninth straight victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Kenny Atkinson said sometimes a lack of energy can affect a team at the end of a road trip, the same thing can happen to a team playing its first home game after jetting across the country.
Post-Match Reflections: Atkinson gave playing time to 13 players in the game with the Mavericks. Seven players finished in double figures. Evan Mobley led the way with 34 points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers are 17-1 on their home court. The only blemish on their home record is a 135-124 loss to the Atlanta Hawks on Nov. 27.
Others: The Hornets are 7-26 and have lost nine straight games.
